intro: Eriastrum signatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf eriastrum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Eriastrum signatum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions.
